messages.messageBody:
On Jun 30, 2006, at 8:31 PM, Beth Fleming wrote:

> I wonder if somebody who is familiar with this game can help....my
> 7 yo boy is interested....can you rate the game for me? It looks
> like a lot of fun, but I wonder if it's a bit complicated for his age.

Have you seen the online demo at Hasbro?

http://www.hasbro.com/heroscape/

It looks pretty extensive and gives a good feel for the game.

Joyce

messages.subject: Re: heroscape
messages.msgSnippet: ... 7 yo boy is interested....can you rate the game for me? Richard is 10, he got interested in Heroscape more than a year ago.  He actually showed me how to
messages.messageBody:
--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, Beth Fleming <momofwc@...> wrote:
> Hi,
> I wonder if somebody who is familiar with this game can help....my
7 yo boy is interested....can you rate the game for me?

Richard is 10, he got interested in Heroscape more than a year ago. He
actually showed me how to play! You can simplify the rules though, and
the pieces are fun even if you just play your own way. There are some
really cool pieces, dragons, vikings, zombie dogs, American Revolution
soldiers, robots, something for everyone.

Katy J. in Southern NM

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] heroscape
messages.msgSnippet: We love heroscape!!  My boys are 10 and 7...it can be pretty complicated trying to play completely by the rules.  So what we started out with was modifiying
messages.messageBody:
We love heroscape!! My boys are 10 and 7...it can be pretty complicated trying to play completely by the rules. So what we started out with was modifiying the easier instructions to fit our needs. And sometimes the boys make up their own rules. It is cool and you can certainly do what you need with it to make it fun for your son and your family.

Hope that helps!

Jenny Elliott
Mom to Beck (10) and Dane (7)

----- Original Message -----
From: Beth Fleming
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com ; alwayslearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, June 30, 2006 5:31 PM
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] heroscape


Hi,
I wonder if somebody who is familiar with this game can help....my 7 yo boy is interested....can you rate the game for me? It looks like a lot of fun, but I wonder if it's a bit complicated for his age.
TIA!
Peace,
Beth

Unschooling Mom to Frances (9), Will (7), Catherine (2), and Grace (6 months)
www.6uvus.blogspot.com
